com.xtracta.supplier.invoiceParser

Class JSONInvoiceParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xtracta.supplier.invoiceParser.AbstractInvoiceParser
      • com.xtracta.supplier.invoiceParser.JSONInvoiceParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Invoice

    public class JSONInvoiceParser
extends AbstractInvoiceParser
    This class parses invoice text using the JSON.simple library. This library provides a reasonable balance between ease-of-use and performance
    Author:
    firas
    See Also:
    comparison benchmark

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JSONInvoiceParser(java.lang.String filePath)
      Parsing the invoice is done by utilizing the JSON-simple library The format of the invoice is almost JSON-compatible, with the one exception that the fields are wrapped by single quote "'" instead of double quote '"' as required by the JSON standard.

      Gets next record from invoice file.
      java.util.ArrayList<InvoiceRecord> order()
      order the invoice records according to their JSON_TAGS.page_id , JSON_TAGS.line_id , and JSON_TAGS.pos_id correspondingly
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> parse()
      parse the invoice into an ordered array based on line numbers so that each invoice line corresponds to a String

    • Constructor Detail

      • JSONInvoiceParser

        public JSONInvoiceParser(java.lang.String filePath)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Parsing the invoice is done by utilizing the JSON-simple library The format of the invoice is almost JSON-compatible, with the one exception that the fields are wrapped by single quote "'" instead of double quote '"' as required by the JSON standard. Hence, single quotes are replaced with double quotes before passing the reconds to the JSON parser. This results in the limitation that supplier names cannot contain a single quote
        Parameters:
        filePath - parse the file at the given path
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - in case of IO errors

    • Method Detail

      • next

        public InvoiceRecord next()
        Gets next record from invoice file. The records are assumed to of JSON format, up to having a single quote "'" around their fields rather than double quotes '"'.

        To enable the JSON library to parse the records, the single quotes are replaced with double quotes.

        This results in the limitation that supplier names cannot have single quotes in them

        Returns:
        the next record or null otherwise

      • order

        public java.util.ArrayList<InvoiceRecord> order()
        order the invoice records according to their JSON_TAGS.page_id , JSON_TAGS.line_id , and JSON_TAGS.pos_id correspondingly
        Returns:
        an array of ordered records

      • parse

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> parse()
        Description copied from interface: Invoice
        parse the invoice into an ordered array based on line numbers so that each invoice line corresponds to a String
        Returns:
        an ordered array of the invoice lines
